main event: On February 23, 1958, a brilliant orange flaming object was observed segmenting into five sections while moving at extremely low speed.
interesting points: The object was first sighted as a single brilliant orange flame before dividing into five sections., The sighting lasted approximately 10 seconds., The conclusion of the sighting was that the object was identified as a balloon., The event took place 8 miles west of Cleveland, Ohio., The observation was categorized as a ground-visual type.
witness description: a guard and a captain in the U.S. Air Force
